title: Debdale Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Peter Teal / Big house and barn, Debdale Park
images.caption: Big house and barn, Debdale Park. View from the lodge gate entrance. Big house now used as an activity centre, barn used by gardening staff.

images.title: Peter Teal / Debdale Sailing Centre
images.caption: Debdale Sailing Centre. To the right of the sailing centre is the Bandstand Public House with its Wacky Warehouse, in the centre right in the background is the spire of Brookfied Unitarian Church. On the lake you can try a range of water based activities including dinghy sailing, kayaking and canoeing.

images.title: Peter Teal / Park Entrance
images.caption: Park entrance off Debdale Lane, used by fairground trucks as can be seen by the state of the railings. The flats in the distance are in Abbey Hey.

images.title: Gerald England / Dog Walking in Debdale Park
images.caption: Dog Walking in Debdale Park. The park is is well-used by dog-walkers and has several bins dotted around the site.

images.title: Setting sail by Gerald England, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Setting sail

description: This 130 acre park includes waterside cycling and walking trails around Lower Gorton Reservoir. The park is the start point for the traffic free Fallowfield Loop cycle route which runs along the National Cycle Network to Chorlton. Our Audenshaw Reservoir Walk visits the park from Guide Bridge train station. It uses a section of the Ashton Canal and the Tameside Trail to visit the reservoirs and the park. It's a nice way to reach the park, particularly if you are coming by public transport.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's an on site cafe where you can enjoy a range of refreshments after your exercise. In the warner months there's often and ice cream van too.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is very popular with dog walkers so you'll probably meet other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The waymarked Tameside Trail passes through the park. You could pick up the path and follow it south for a couple of miles to visit the nearby Reddish Vale Country Park. The popular park includes nice trails along the River Tame, a Visitor Centre, Community Orchard and Garden, Butterfly Conservation Field and a Dipping Pond. Near here there's also the bluebell woodland and wildlife in Haughton Dale Nature Reserve at Haughton Green. The epic Trans Pennine Trail and the Midshires Way can also be picked up here.

display_address: Manchester Trafalgar Sea Cadet Corps, Wall Way, Reddish Bridge, Gorton, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, M18 7LJ, United Kingdom
